'''Nathalie Kotowksi''' (12 March 1932<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=http://www.grijalvo.com/Hfz002/hfz002_b_Nathalie_Kotowski.htm|articlename=Nathalie Kotowski - Carta a Halifirien|author=Juan Manuel Grijalvo|dated=2001|accessed=06-12-2011|website=[https://www.grijalvo.com/Hfz002/hfz002_1aa0_Indice.htm Halifirien 2]}}</ref> - 27 August 2001<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://www.jrrvf.com/fluxbb/viewtopic.php?id=4973|articlename=Décès de Nathalie Kotowski|author=Eruvike|dated=2001|accessed=25-05-2024|website=[https://www.jrrvf.com/fluxbb/index.php Tolkien en Version Française - Forum]}}</ref>) was a Belgian Tolkien collector and author.

==History==
Nathalie Kotowski was the founder of [[Belegaer (Tolkien Society)|Belegaer - Cercle d'etudes de Tolkien en Belgique]] as well as editor-in-chief of its magazine ''Cirth De Gandalf''.

Aside from being involved in Belegaer, Nathalie was also underwriter of ''[[Beyond Bree]]'' and a member of [[The Tolkien Society]].<ref>http://www.cep.unt.edu/bree/Back-Issues1.pdf (accessed 06-12-2011)</ref> Nathalie was also occasionally interviewed by the media on the subject of Tolkien.<ref>http://hemeroteca.lavanguardia.com/preview/1997/11/23/pagina-18/34646661/pdf.html?search=Ima%20Sanch%C3%ADs (accessed 06-12-2011)</ref> Nathalie attended the 1992 Centenary conference.<ref>
{{Cite web|articleurl=https://dc.swosu.edu/mythlore/vol18/iss4/5/|articlename=Pictures from the Tolkien Centenary Conference|author=Bg Callahan and Glen GoodKnight|dated=1992|website=[[Mythlore 70]]}}

</ref>
